titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Phoenix Masonic Lodge No. 8 records, 1793-1854

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection includes articles of agreement, 1798, leasing part of Mason's Hall to Fayetteville Academy for three years; and a contract for construction work on the lodge, 1793.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Phoenix Masonic Lodge No. 8 records, 1793-1854, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Phoenix Lodge No. 8 in Fayetteville, N. C., was established on Nov. 17, 1788 under dispensation from the Grand Lodge of Ancient York Masons of North Carolina. It received "Number 8" in 1791, and was first chartered by the Grand Lodge of North Carolina in 1793.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes articles of agreement, 1798, leasing part of Mason's Hall to Fayetteville Academy for three years; and a contract for construction work on the lodge, 1793.
